intro: Rosa coriifolia var. repudiata, commonly known as the white thorned rose, is a variant of the Chinese rose, characterized by its distinctive, thorned stems and fragrant white flowers. It is native to the mountainous regions of China and is valued for its ornamental qualities. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, with simple, ovate leaves and showy, single blooms that appear in early summer. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for garden cultivation. This variety is also noted for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in temperate climates.
